summary: This is an AT&T wireless invoice for Jeffrey E. Epstein's account, dated February 14, 2004, covering the billing period from January 13 to February 12, 2004. It details monthly charges, payments, adjustments, and includes a lengthy call log showing numerous domestic and international calls, including many to/from Switzerland and France. The account shows a credit balance and is noted as being in a canceled status.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The primary account holder for the AT&T wireless service detailed in this invoice. The bill is addressed to him and his company at 457 Madison Ave, New York, NY.

persons.name: G. Maxwell
persons.context: Listed on the invoice summary with a charge of $357.99, indicating a line or service associated with Jeffrey Epstein's wireless account.

connections.description: G. Maxwell's wireless charges appear on Jeffrey Epstein's AT&T account invoice, indicating a financial or service-sharing relationship.

events.title: Wireless Billing Cycle Start
events.description: The billing cycle for Jeffrey Epstein's AT&T wireless account begins.

events.title: Wireless Billing Cycle End
events.description: The billing cycle for Jeffrey Epstein's AT&T wireless account ends.

events.title: Payment Received
events.description: A payment of $1,485.48 credit is received on Jeffrey Epstein's AT&T wireless account.

events.title: Payment Received
events.description: A payment of $3,308.41 credit is received on Jeffrey Epstein's AT&T wireless account.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's AT&T wireless account was billed to 'JEFFREY E EPSTEIN & CO' at 457 Madison Ave, New York, NY.
The invoice includes charges for a line associated with 'G. MAXWELL' totaling $357.99.
The account had a significant credit balance ($116.82CR) and was noted as being in a 'canceled status' as of the bill date.
The detailed call log shows a high volume of calls in January 2004, including many international calls to/from Switzerland and France.
Payments totaling $4,793.89 in credits were received on the account in January and February 2004.
